intro: Arberella bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia arberella, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Arberella bahiensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
